column7: Thickets to 1200 metres in W. China[109]. Sunny slopes, streamsides, montane valleys, thickets and waste places at elevations of 200 - 2600 metres[266].
column16: Rubus corchorifolius is a deciduous Shrub growing to 2.5 m (8ft 2in).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 6.  It is in flower in June, and the seeds ripen from July to August. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Insects.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers  moist soil.
column21: Fruit - raw or cooked[1, 2, 105]. A delicious vinous flavour[11]. The red fruits are up to 12mm in diameter[266].
column23: Plants For A Future can not take any responsibility for any adverse effects from the use of plants. Always seek advice from a professional before using a plant medicinally.None known
column25: A purple to dull blue dye is obtained from the fruit[168].
column27: Easily grown in a good well-drained loamy soil in sun or semi-shade[1, 11, 200]. An aggressive plant, it spreads vigorously but may be of value in the wild garden[11]. Succeeds in a woodland garden[200]. This species is a raspberry with biennial stems, it produces a number of new stems each year from the perennial rootstock, these stems fruit in their second year and then die[200]. Plants in this genus are notably susceptible to honey fungus[200].
column28: Seed - requires stratification and is best sown in early autumn in a cold frame. Stored seed requires one month stratification at about 3°c and is best sown as early as possible in the year. Prick out the seedlings when they are large enough to handle and grow on in a cold frame. Plant them out into their permanent positions in late spring of the following year. Cuttings of half-ripe wood, July/August in a frame[200]. Tip layering in July. Plant out in autumn. Division in early spring or just before leaf-fall in the autumn[200].
